r.t: You have to fill them with values else the test will fail
You can leave them empty unless needed
(Sheet name and column name are user defined)
You can add as many sheets and cells as needed

The test enables simulating a big scale of trade processing / validation via the new OSP module. Different types of processing actions can be simulated with this test: Validation Events: Cancel and Cancel&Reissue OSP Netting The user can provide the test with the selection criteria of the items to validate (category, sub-category, queue, filtering column and filtering value) and the type of action to be performed. All the information needed to configure the test will be available in the excel template. In excel there should be at least 3 sheets configured. The sheets are “

” details sheet. The latter includes all details needed to validate the trade including User login credentials, OSP configuration and the items to validate. The first sheet called “UserConfig” factorizes the User login credentials whereas the second sheet “OSPConfig” factorizes the OSP configuration like selection of category, subcategory and queue to reach the list of contracts we need to validate. The third, and fourth sheets factorize the items to validate in the contract, exceptions views respectively for the different objects (i.e. trades, payments ...etc) to validate. These four sheets are referenced in the “Validation” details sheet for the sake of readability and easier maintenance / modification of the test data in the future.
In addition to the mandatory sheets, there are other

Sheets that have “^” character in their names will be ignored during test execution.
Please refer to the cells' comments to know about what to fill each column

si.t: In this sheet the user speficies the Deliverable details of the generated payments after the split event
This sheet is used to configure the asset configuration to be added in the allocated assets panel.
